meanings.definition: An heir apparent in Celtic tradition.
meanings.sent1: In Celtic stories, the tanist was always ready to take over as the next leader.
meanings.sent2: The tanist was next in line to inherit the throne according to the ancient Celtic customs.
meanings.sent3: The tanist couldn't help but feel a mix of excitement and nervousness about becoming the new leader.
meanings.sent4: Being the tanist was like holding a key to a door that would only open when the time was right.
meanings.sent5: The tanist's role was crucial, like a puzzle piece that completed the royal lineage.

meanings.definition: A person designated to succeed or inherit a position or title.
meanings.sent1: The company's tanist was being prepared to take on the responsibilities of the CEO.
meanings.sent2: As the tanist, he knew he had big shoes to fill when the time came for him to step up.
meanings.sent3: It was a great honor for him to be chosen as the tanist, even though it came with great expectations.
meanings.sent4: Becoming the tanist felt like being handed a golden ticket to a future full of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The tanist's role was like being the understudy in a play, always ready to take the lead role.

meanings.definition: The act of designating a successor.
meanings.sent1: The tanist ceremony was a solemn event where the next leader was officially named.
meanings.sent2: The tanist process involved careful consideration to ensure the right person was chosen.
meanings.sent3: During the tanist ritual, everyone held their breath in anticipation of the successor's name.
meanings.sent4: The tanist tradition symbolized the continuity of leadership within the community.
meanings.sent5: The tanist ritual was like passing a torch of responsibility from one generation to the next.
